result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: FPT adj from 10/17 to 11/11 @ 8:30am on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date
Final pre-trial on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:21 AM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Peter G. Hale, appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   Victim rights compliance. Attorney Ward is requesting an adjournment as he just received an offer from the State and needs to request additional discovery. Court adjourns.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Return to sender.  Rotation letter returned in mail.

ADDRESS INFO for Peter G. Hale
Current: 906 N Glenwood Dr, Silver Lake, WI 53170-1626   (Effective: 04-08-2022)
Prior: 7317 18th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143
from Attorney Ward updating DE's address

Defendant, Peter G. Hale, appeared with Attorney John Anthony Ward.  Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Ward. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:20 am.
PH is rescheduled from 04-22 to 05-05-22 at 8:30am Intake. DA notified.
per the Court, request to adjourn is denied unless a waiver of time limits is filed.  Atty emailed waiver form.

Adjustment Number: 22A 236906,
Payable Number: 340320,
Receipt Number: 22R 010893,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Joann O or Patricia F.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:01 PM    Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on April 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.  $2000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
